alert.note: Alert for Matagorda; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 1:18AM CST until January 26 at 6:24AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Tres Palacios River near Midfield affecting Matagorda and Wharton Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. For the Tres Palacios River...including Midfield...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tres Palacios River near Midfield. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water spills into the flood plain on the right upstream bank and covers the meander point at the meander curve. At 26.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins with water well into the flood plain on the right upstream bank and within inches of spilling over the east approach to the bridge at FM 456. The river will be almost one quarter mile wide in the vicinity of the gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 24.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 AM CST Thursday was 24.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.2 feet on 06/23/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Tres Palacios River Midfield 24.0 24.5 Thu 12 am CS 22.6 13.6 7.0 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued later this morning.this evening at 730 PM CST.
